units.title: Prepare EdU working solution
units.text: Make a 10 μM (1×) solution of EdU in both base medium and colon monolayer differentiation medium by diluting the 10 mM (1,000×) stock solution of EdU (component A of the kit).
units.rationale: Creates the required EdU concentration for labeling.

units.title: Add EdU to apical and basolateral compartments
units.text: Add 500 µl of the 1× EdU in base medium solution onto the apical side of the monolayer, and 1.5 ml of the 1× EdU in colon monolayer differentiation medium onto the basolateral side of the monolayer.
units.rationale: Delivers EdU to both sides of the epithelial monolayer.

units.title: Incubate monolayers overnight
units.text: Return monolayers to the incubator (5% CO2, 37 °C), and incubate overnight (16 h).
units.rationale: Allows EdU incorporation into proliferating cells.

units.title: Fix monolayers with paraformaldehyde
units.text: Once incubation period is complete, remove the medium from both sides of the monolayer, and replace it with ﬁxative solution (4% paraformaldehyde in DPBS−/−), with 500 µl on both the apical and basolateral sides of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 15 min.
units.rationale: Preserves cellular structures for downstream staining.

units.title: Wash monolayers with BSA buffer
units.text: Aspirate the ﬁxative solution, and wash the monolayers at least twice with 3% BSA in DPBS−/− (1 ml on the apical side, 2 ml on the basolateral side of the monolayer).
units.rationale: Removes fixative and blocks nonspecific binding.

units.title: Permeabilize cells
units.text: Add 500 µl of the permeabilization solution (0.2% Triton X-100 in DPBS−/−) to both apical and basolateral sides of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 20 min.
units.rationale: Creates pores for Click‑iT reagents to access DNA.

units.title: Prepare Click‑iT reaction cocktail
units.text: Prepare the Click-iT reaction cocktail containing 1× Click-iT reaction buffer, CuSO4, Alexa Fluor azide and reaction buffer additive, according to the manufacturer’s procedure.
units.rationale: Assembles the reagents needed for fluorescent labeling of incorporated EdU.

units.title: Perform Click‑iT labeling
units.text: Aspirate permeabilization solution, and wash the monolayers at least twice with 3% BSA in DPBS−/−. Add 500 µl of the Click-iT reaction cocktail to the apical side of the monolayer. Incubate at room temperature for 30 min.
units.rationale: Covalently attaches fluorophore to EdU‑labeled DNA.

units.title: Prepare monolayers for imaging
units.text: After carrying out any additional staining, or immediately after Step 9, immerse monolayers in DPBS−/− (applying 500 µl to the apical and 1,500 µl basolateral sides), and proceed with imaging and analysis.
units.rationale: Places samples in a compatible buffer for microscopy.

units.title: Centrifuge organoid suspension at 4 °C
units.text: Centrifuge at 500g for 5 min at 4 °C. During centrifugation, prepare the material for the subsequent steps: sterilize a glass dish with PREempt disinfectant solution and 70% ethanol. Add ice to 50–70% capacity of the glass dish, spray with 70% ethanol again and place the dish into the biosafety cabinet. Put Matrigel aliquots into the aluminum cooling block. Spray thoroughly with 70% ethanol, and place it into the glass dish containing ice.
units.rationale: Pellets organoids while keeping them cold for downstream processing.
